data.title: Nogiku no Haka
data.synopsis:
An educational film about love and respect. 

Tamiko (17) and Masao (15) are cousins. They grew up together as siblings but in adulthood they wanted to wed each other. However Tamiko's sister-in-law was jealous and tried to tear them apart by forcing Tamiko to marry another man.

data.title: Goi-sensei to Tarou
data.synopsis: Tarou is the only student in the class that Goi-sensei uses an honorific for. This extremely bothers Tarou as he's the only Tarou in the class and it is unneeded. Over winter break Goi-sensei is hospitalized and Tarou goes to visit him and hears the story of why he uses an honorific for Tarou.

data.title: Tegami
data.synopsis: A young boy lives with his grandfather who survived WW2. When a letter comes in the main, the grandfather begins to weeps. He then tells his grandson the story of about this letter his friend wrote.

titles.title: 明治維新をつくりあげた人々

data.title: Meiji Ishin wo Tsukuriageta Hitobito
data.title_japanese: 明治維新をつくりあげた人々
data.synopsis: An educational film about Yukichi Fukuzawa who helped head the Meiji Restoration after Japan's 200 year isolation.

titles.title: Tenka wo Mezashita Sannin no Bushou
天下をめざした３人の武将

data.title: Tenka wo Mezashita Sannin no Bushou
data.title_japanese: 天下をめざした３人の武将
data.synopsis: An educational anime about the 3 major warlords in the Sengoku era. Oda Nobunaga, Toyotomi Hideyoshi, and Tokugawa Ieyasu.

data.title: Tokugawa Iemitsu to Edo Bakufu
data.synopsis: An educational film about Tokugawa Iemitsu. He was the grandson of Tokugawa Ieyasa (who founded the Tokugawa shogunate and ended the Sengoku era with his victory). Iemitsu is mostly known for his xenophobia and tried to close Japan to the world, this is known as Sakoku. The policies he put into place blocked out Japan for nearly 200 years which eventually caused internal strife and internal war in the Meiji era when Japan opened its borders again only to find it was economically, politically, industrially, scientifically, and culturally behind the rest of the world.

titles.title: Minamoto no Yoritomo to Bushi no Yononaka
源頼朝と武士の世の中

data.title: Minamoto no Yoritomo to Bushi no Yononaka
data.title_japanese: 源頼朝と武士の世の中
data.synopsis: An educational film about Minamoto no Yoritomo. He founded the Kamakura shogunate which reigned from 1192 to 1333.

data.title: Kumo no Ito (2000)
data.synopsis: Kandata was a thief in life so he suffers in hell because of it. But once before he died he helped a spider. One day a silk thread comes down from above and Kandata attempts to climb it in order to reach paradise but...

data.title: Mother Teresa
data.synopsis: A biographical anime about Mother Teresa.

data.title: Gin no Rousokutate
data.synopsis: A retelling of Victor Hugo's crime from Les Misérables.

data.title: Ao no Doumon
data.synopsis:
Legend has it that before the tunnel (Ao no Doumon) was built, people had to climb over the cliffs through which the tunnel is built to reach an important local shrine. The path was very dangerous and people regularly fell to their deaths. During the Edo period, a Buddhist monk named Zenkai, who had committed a murder in his earlier life, decided to build a safe passage for worshipers in order to atone for his crime. Beginning at the age of 49, he dedicated 30 years of his life to digging the 185 metre tunnel by hand, using only a hammer and chisel.

(Source: Wikipedia)

titles.title: とも子ちゃんとわたし

data.title: Tomoko-chan to Watashi
data.title_japanese: とも子ちゃんとわたし
data.synopsis:
A film meant to show how to deal with "lively" children in the classroom. 

While not outwardly stated, Tomoko-chan may have some form of ADD or mild autism or both as most kids her age are lively but Tomoko-chan is more wound up than regular children.

data.title: Hage
data.synopsis: An educational film about premature baldness. Specifically aimed at children balding.

titles.title: ぼくのダイエット大作戦

data.title: Boku no Diet Daisakusen
data.title_japanese: ぼくのダイエット大作戦
data.synopsis: An educational film about childhood obesity in Japan.

data.title: Kokoro no Hanataba
data.synopsis: A sweet story about an old man who went around town planting seeds everywhere in order for flowers to bloom for his granddaughter.

data.title: Haha Uzura
data.synopsis: An educational anime about the importance of life. A boy and his father go hunting. The boy shoots a quail only to find a nest of chicks nearby.

data.title: Inori no Te
data.synopsis: An educational anime about Hans Dürer.

data.title: Inamura no Hi (1989)
data.synopsis: Tells the real story about the 1854 Nankai earthquake and subsequent tsunami. 5 samurai villagemen tried to warn villages to evacuate after seeing the tsunami in the distance and it fell mostly on deaf ears. They then set fire to threshed rice in order to have the villagers run up to the fields in order to put out the fire thinking the whole crop is on fire. The plan worked and almost every village member ran up as the rice crops were their only livelihood. The tsunami came and the whole villages below were destroyed thus saving the villagers from death.

data.title: Donguri to Yamaneko (1995)
data.synopsis: A retelling of Miyazawa Kenji's story of The Acorns and the Wildcat.

data.title: Cello Hiki no Gauche (OVA)
data.synopsis: Gauche is having trouble perfecting his piece for his performance in 10 days when he hears a knock on his door...

data.title: Naita Aka Oni (OVA)
data.synopsis: A red Oni wants to become friends with the villagers but is finding it hard because a blue Oni is terrorizing them.

data.title: Yume, Sora Takaku
data.synopsis: An educational film about the independence of children.

data.title: Ichimai no Etegami
data.synopsis: An educational film about town planning and factoring the opinion of the elderly as they have lived there the longest.

たすけあいの歴史 ─生命保険のはじまり─

data.title_japanese: たすけあいの歴史 ─生命保険のはじまり─

titles.title: 約束 －アフリカ　水と緑－

data.title: Yakusoku: Africa Mizu to Midori
data.title_japanese: 約束 －アフリカ　水と緑－
data.synopsis: An educational film about technology and perseverance can help those less fortunate. In the film's example, it's building a green wall and green sanctuary to combat the spreading desert in Africa in order for native Africans to have a better life.
